publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-2603 Bill Wilson: Appreciation of Renfrewshire’s Emergency Services—That the Parliament congratulates the staff of Renfrewshire Council, Strathclyde Fire and Rescue and the police in Renfrewshire on their combined efforts to ensure that the Maich dam near Lochwinnoch was made safe after subsidence following heavy rain last month and notes that the dam holds more than 20,000 tonnes of water and that, due to the quick actions of these local services, the safety of the local residents was maintained. Supported by: Aileen Campbell*, Alasdair Allan*, Bashir Ahmad*, Hugh Henry* Motions and amendments which have attracted additional support

S3M-2603 Bill Wilson: Appreciation of Renfrewshire’s Emergency Services—That the Parliament congratulates the staff of Renfrewshire Council, Strathclyde Fire and Rescue and the police in Renfrewshire on their combined efforts to ensure that the Maich dam near Lochwinnoch was made safe after subsidence following heavy rain last month and notes that the dam holds more than 20,000 tonnes of water and that, due to the quick actions of these local services, the safety of the local residents was maintained. Supported by: Aileen Campbell, Alasdair Allan, Bashir Ahmad, Hugh Henry, Bill Kidd*, Trish Godman*
S3M-2603 Appreciation of Renfrewshire’s Emergency Services (lodged on 25 September 2008) Gil Paterson*, Cathy Jamieson*
S3M-2603 Appreciation of Renfrewshire’s Emergency Services (lodged on 25 September 2008) Sandra White*
